main.java.com.jamobox.jamchatserver.clients

Class Client

  • java.lang.Object
    • main.java.com.jamobox.jamchatserver.clients.Client

  • public class Client
extends java.lang.Object
    This class defines what a client is. ALL clients MUST be an instance of this class, and any possible different client types (if this is ever implemented) should also extend this class.
    Author:
    Pete Wicken

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Client(java.net.Socket socket)
      Creates a Client object setting the client's socket to be the one passed through the parameters.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Client

        public Client(java.net.Socket socket)
        Creates a Client object setting the client's socket to be the one passed through the parameters. Also sets the client address to be the local address of the socket.
        Parameters:
        socket - The socket to bind the client to.

    • Method Detail

      • getUsername

        public java.lang.String getUsername()
        Returns:
        The client's unique username.

      • getAddress

        public java.net.InetAddress getAddress()
        Returns:
        The client's ip address.

      • setUsername

        public void setUsername(java.lang.String username)
        Set the username of the client.
        Parameters:
        username - The username to use.

      • getClientReader

        public java.io.BufferedReader getClientReader()
                                       throws java.io.IOException
        Get the client's input stream.
        Returns:
        BufferedReader object of client input stream.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • getClientWriter

        public java.io.PrintWriter getClientWriter()
                                    throws java.io.IOException
        Get the client's output stream.
        Returns:
        PrintWriter object of client output stream.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • sendMessage

        public void sendMessage(java.lang.String message)
        Attempts to send the given message to the client's output stream.
        Parameters:
        message - The message to send the client.

      • disconnect

        public void disconnect()
        Attempts to disconnect the client from the server. Uses default disconnect message.

      • disconnect

        public void disconnect(java.lang.String reason)
        Disconnect a client's connection for a given reason. This should mainly be used by authentication methods and any other methods that are called when a user first connects, however this may also be used to cleanly disconnect the client, by the client's own request or by the server itself.
        Parameters:
        reason - The reason for the disconnection.
